description:
Earl did an AMAZING job and made me the BEST Key Lime Pie that I have EVER had (says a lot because I lived in FL for 15 years before moving to SF). 

The texture was perfectly firm yet creamy, the balance of sweet and tart was exceptional and the crust was graham cracker buttery goodness (and I loved how it crumbled...not too firm like eating a graham cracker whole). 

Thank you Earl!
author: Erica S.

description:
The service is ultra-nice and I would love to support this shop, but the quality and taste just does not justify both the price and calories. Maybe their cakes are better though? I kind of have a feeling they don't always sell the freshest baked goods and maybe my batch were 1+ day old.

Shared the walnut brownie and lemon bar. I couldn't get myself to finish either half.

The ghirardelli brownie mix is a lot more moist, chewier and packed with chocolate flavor. Even without the mix, I think most at-home brownies are better than this one. 

The lemon bar crust is bad. I wish the lemon gelatin part was more lemony. It needs some umph, though I don't have a solution.

At $3.75 a piece, I'd rather go to a bougie bakery (e.g., Craftsman and Wolves, b.pattisserie) to spend my money and waste my calories. Or go across the street and eat Bob's Donuts!!!
author: Jeanie N.

description:
Lotta's Bakery is a unique place, it's an antique shop within a bakery - or a bakery within an  antique shop. That itself sets Lotta's Bakery apart from most other places and is already reason enough to stop by and visit Lotta's Bakery.
We recently ordered our wedding cake from Lotta's Bakery. We went for their signature Princess Cake and it is to die for. It is soooo delicious, yummy, you won't be able to stop eating!!! If you have any kind of celebration coming up that requires a cake, do yourself a favor and go to Lotta's Bakery.  
On top, Earl, the owner, is AMAZING. I am sure you can find other bakeries with delicious cakes, but Earl will go the extra mile for you - and this is something you won't find anywhere else. 
We will be back and so should you!
author: F. P.

description:
Really disappointed after seeing the high reviews here. What is unique about the bakery is that it's an antique shop too. Quirky!

I picked up a red velvet cupcake this weekend, and it was extremely stale. Dry and dry! My heart hurt to throw both the baked good and my money down the drain. What a waste!

Note they also don't carry decaf coffee here. Asked about it, and the response was that no one had asked for it in 8 months. Judge much?

Skip it! You'll waste a whole lotta of your taste buds and money here.
author: Tricia D.

description: Very easy to place orders by phone for special occasions, with various sizes that allows less cake to be tossed if the event is for a small party. Owner/baker is friendly. Also sells antiques.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
It's a bakery and an antique shop all in one. You'll miss the bakery if you think you see antiques and walk right by but walk in and you'll go past some antiques to see yummy baked goods. Then more antiques and then a huge kitchen area for him to bake. I had no idea there was a giant kitchen behind the store. 

My favorite CARROT CAKE with amazing cream cheese frosting. And no raisins! I bought a 4" cake ($20) just because.  I felt a little guilty when he asked if I wanted any writing on it. I was like um, no it's just because I want carrot cake and why buy one slice when I can order the whole cake

Red velvet is pretty good too but the cake itself is a little on the drier side but the frosting is so good.

Strawberry cream with white chocolate flower cake is really good too.  The white chocolate is a little sweet but it's actually a nice accent for the cake.

Order your full cakes 24 hours in advance or just ask him.  I ordered less than 24 hours before and they were able to do it (ordered at 5pm for 2pm the next day). I think it depends on how busy they are and what you're requesting.  

Love love love this place.

Accepts credit card over a certain amount - I think $10 but I forgot.
author: Traci H.

description:
I was walking down Polk street after hitting the gym on a beautiful Friday afternoon and realized I was craving something sweet. So I looked up the closest bakeries on Yelp and came across this little gem. 

I walked in the bakery and to my right there were all kinds of great looking cookies, but right underneath these cookies I spotted something even more magical: magic bars. 

Magic bars are every brownie lover's dream. They contain coconut, chocolate chips and I'm not sure what else, but I could taste the butter so there's definitely some butter in there... Needless to say, it was freaking amazing and I'm glad I went to the gym beforehand. Totally.worth.it.
author: Sabrina B.

description: Its an antique shop within a bakery.  I'd been shopping all around this business and somehow never noticed it and went in.  The guy that works the counter is terrific, rare to see enthusiastic, friendly. efficient staff in this city.  I recommend the pumpkin bread, moist, delicious, possibly the best I've ever tried.  Good work guys, I'll be back.  I've also tried the cookies and mini chocolate tart, pumpkin bread is where they shine!
author: M M.

description: Their cakes looked great, I ordered a brownie and 2 cookies. The brownie was good, and everything was well priced, but I have to give 3 stars because both of the cookies were hard as rocks :(
author: Colleen R.

description: Love Lotta's.  I've been going ever since a friend gave me a box of the bakery's cookies years ago.  Stopped in today before closing for some cake for my birthday, a delish plum cake.  Had to get cookies too.
author: E C.

description:
Cake was delicious (red velvet). Cake design - Earl did an amazing job and everyone was talking about it at the party. This the second cake from Earl in the past 6 months, and they have been perfect each time. The price is great for what you get, compared to some other higher priced (and not so tasty) places in the city. John is super helpful too. 
Try them you will not be sorry!!
I will definitely be calling upon Earl for my next celebration!!
author: Sara R.

description: I live close to this place , but it's my first time buying from here. I ordered a lemon custard cake with blueberries & white chocolate for my sis's birthday. It's good, but just a little too sweet. The 4" is enough for my family to share and not eat too much ! Thanks.
author: Catherine S.

description: Holy jeez!  That was the most delicious German Chocolate cake I've ever had.  God bless my coworker for having a birthday!!
author: S. Y.

description:
I have been bringing my business to Lotta's Bakery for the past 2years. Since then, Earl (Chef Baker) has been delivering some of the most amazing, great tasting cakes. In August, we decided to use  Lotta's Bakery for our wedding event. Let me tell you, from the initial cake testing, to the delivery of the cake, I have been satisfied with the overall service and products Lotta's Bakery has been delivering. 

During our cake testing, Earl took the time to get to know us as customers, along with explaining the styles and flavors of the cakes we were tasting. Ultimately, my wife fell in love with the service and the cake (simple white butter cream cake with strawberries).  Earl was also kind enough to let us borrow a cake stand at no charge.

If your looking for great tasting cakes and service, then this is your place.
author: Hugo C.

description:
Stumbled upon this place through Yelp this past weekend. I was looking for a place to get a small cake to celebrate my friend's birthday. All other places seem to offer cakes 6" or bigger, nothing smaller...except this place. They offer a 4" cake for about $20, a perfect size for folks who are watching their figures but want a small taste. I found out that if you don't give the bakery at least a 24 hour notice, they will implement a $5 extra charge so please be advised. 

When I came to pick up the cake the gentleman that helped me was super sweet. Although I forgot his name (he goes by a different name than his official name), he was knowledgeable and told me about the French pastry chef who takes the time to make these mater pieces and was nice enough to provide me with a candle for my cake. Although a small 4" cake, they were able to customize it with "Happy Birthday Sese," the name of my friend. The flavor I got was a red velvet cake and it was moist and delicious. I'm definitely coming back in the future, so happy it's right around the corner from me on Polk. 

Great job Lotta's! I'm coming back for that bread pudding!
author: Rockne H.

description:
i bought a piece of orange sponge cake  it was dried , also tasted cheap , the frosting tasted just sugary,
this cake was not a sponge cake at all !!! tasted like a  simple cake !!!!!! not good at all.
service :  the guy who works there also seems like he was in a bad mood  . 
if u work  specially in a bakery a little smile does not hurt and is free .
i will never go back there.
author: Cecilia C.

description: We have been stopping by to try different goodies whenever we are near Lotta's. Every item we order has been excellent so far- we love the Cheese scone, chicken pie, pumpkin bread and this season- hot cross buns! Next we plan to try the sweet stuff: lemon meringue tarts and red velvet cupcakes.
author: Helen M.

description:
Lotta's bakery was one of a few we tasted before we had a cake made for our wedding.  Once we saw the princess cake and tasted it we were sold.  It is a really classic look and was perfect for us.  Earl was great to work with and we recommend him and his beautiful shop.

Stop in and have some cake while taking a look at the antiques in his store! It is a wonderful stop on any Polk street walk.

We will be back in the future!
author: Matt D.

description: Cute little shop.  It was an antique shop and a bakery.  Small and very charming.  The lemon merengue tart was delicious - the merengue was amazing!  The bundt cake and the cream cheese brownie were also delicious.  Great little place to stop in for a quick treat!
author: Shelley M.

description: Was given a princess cake for my birthday. It was absolutely beautiful but unfortunately looked much better than it tasted. The custard and whipped cream we're fine but the cake was probably one of the driest cakes I have EVER HAD. It also tasted like a super dry vanilla cake rather than a sponge cake (the type of cake that is traditionally in all princess cakes). It was very disappointing and INEDIBLE. I would not recommend ever getting a princess cake here and hope that this was just a mistake (?)
author: Isabella L.

description:
This is a lovely neighborhood bakery and amazing customer service. The cakes made to order are done perfectly with decorations as you want and taste delicious. They can do any edible decorations on the cake and give great suggestions too. We get the birthday cakes always from here and they are always perfect and so special!
P. S. I love the carrot cake!
author: Neha M.

description: I ordered a lemon meringue pie for my Sister's birthday and it was exquisite! We asked for extra meringue because it's our favorite part. The meringue was perfect. It reminded us of our French grandmother's meringue we loved as children. It was my first time trying this bakery and I chose it based on the good reviews. The service was top notch too. Please try this place, you will love it.
author: Kimberly C.

description: I was looking for a German chocolate cake for a birthday celebration and discovered Lotta's Bakery. The order was for the day before Thanksgiving, so I knew they would be very busy.  When I went to pick it up, the order was ready to go, and turned out to be the most delicious German chocolate cake any of us had ever eaten. These folks are bakers!
author: Mary T.

description: My girlfriend & I decided to get married the night of the 2016 presidential election. We notified our immediate family in Ohio & NY and they decided to fly out for our city hall wedding. My mom searched bakeries online and found Lotta's-- she called from Cincinnati and ordered a red velvet cake to celebrate us. It was delivered to our hotel and it was both beautiful and delicious! Thanks for contributing to our celebration!
author: Becca H.

description: Thanks Earl for making Becca and Kat's wedding cake so special. The girls really loved the cake and everyone agreed it was delicious.  It was a pleasure working with you and I wish you much happiness.
author: Mary L.

description: Love this place. Always delicious. Cute. Tons of interesting items for sale inside. I've been coming here for years, just felt the need to get a review in. The chocolate silk cake is amazing. Seems to be my go to for birthdays. Everything I've had here is amazing. I've even bought a few of the odd items that they sell. One of them being an actual tin man.
author: Lisa A.

description:
So I trekked up to this part of Nob Hill in order to try Bob's donuts. After suffering through that disappointment, I was walking around and passed by Lotta's and popped in here on a whim. I am so glad I did.

Lotta's is an eccentric shop which combines a bakery with an antique shop which serves coffee. Strange, I know, but they pull it off. After talking for a bit with the very friendly antique dealer/bakery cashier, I ordered a few unique pastries that caught my eye. They seem to be popular for their pies as well, although I did not try any of them. Maybe next time.

Hamentashen - This is a small triangular pastry which has jewish origins. It has a poppy seed paste in the center. It turned out to be slightly sweet and very interesting. I would rate it slightly above average, although I don't think I would order it again.

Blackstrap molasses gingerbread - I had high hopes for this item as I love gingerbread and am a big fan of molasses. Sadly, it did not really deliver and I did not end up finishing it. It was not as moist as it looks although it did have a decent flavor.

Baba au rum - Wow. Just wow. I randomly ordered this as my last item because I noticed rum in the name. I wish I had ordered two more of these instead of the other stuff I got. It was simply amazing. Dripping in rum, this pastry was soft and sweet and delicious. I will be coming back here for this again and again.
author: Mark O.

description: This place is amazing! I had to call soooo many bakeries to find one that made a German chocolate cake and this place did!! The price was reasonable and they decorated it exactly as I asked. Now for the real important part... This was the BEST CAKE I HAVE EVER TASTED!!! So moist and full of the yumminess! We are it for breakfast the next 2 days after serving!! Thank you so much for making my husbands 30th birthday memorable with your amazing cake!!
author: Jessica W.

description: This place is one of the weirdest, yet best hole-in-the-walls I could have the happy fortune of stumbling upon. I had no clue this place even existed until my girlfriend went next door to KT Nails (great place, by the way) to get her nails done. It just so happened there was a cafe next door, and I had an interview to prep for. Coffee is $1.80 for a cup of organic joe (decaf or regular, your choice), and cookies are .80 a piece or $8/dozen (try one of their, gooey oatmeal raisins, you'll thank me later). There are also massive pies (apple, rhubarb, etc.), bread pudding, and pastries of all kind, all of which are extraordinarily cheap. After you're done eating (place is tiny and has about 3 small tables), you can peruse this store's many antique delights. Ah, if you're into clowns, and I don't know why you would be, there's a creepy one outside that you can sit. Don't know if you'll thank me later for that one. Service is great as well. Can't go wrong with the people who run Lotta's.
author: Danny C.

description: What an eclectic mix--an antique store and bakery!  The bakery was a feast for the eyes with so many wonderful looking desserts. But since we had just bought half a dozen donuts from Bob's Donuts down the street (and I have a weakness for chicken pot pies) we picked up pies. The pies are a must, buttery flakey crust with savory chicken filling.  So delicious reheated. What a surprise!
author: Terry W.

description: I picked up a lemon merengue pie for my husbands birthday and it was delicious.  Yum!
author: Laura M.

description: Here's the deal:  this place has AMAZING baked goods, made the old school way.  They have my favorite bread pudding in town (made from the challah bread they make in store). The gentlemen at the counter are always so pleasant and informed about their products. The berry tarts are always sooooo delicious. I just... I just can't.
author: Pam L.

description: Came here for a gender reveal cake.  They were super friendly and got me a beautiful lemon curd cake the next day.  I don't know if all reveal cakes are like this, but the "reveal" part was just in the middle, so it was fun to cut the slice and pull it mostly out before we had our surprise.  I've walked past this place a zillion times and so am glad I finally had a reason to go in.
author: Keith A.

description: How did this gem escape me?! Ordered a reveal carrot cake from here and it was a resounding success. Tasted wonderful and great value for the money. I've never had so many guests compliment the flavor of a cake before. Easy to order in advance and to pick up on the day. Be sure to check out some of the other desserts when you stop in.
author: Robin R.

description: Made a pineapple upside down cake for my husband's birthday! Was delicious with lots of caramel flavors.  In particular, they did a great job putting the wording on top of the pineapple (which is a bit tricky by the nature of the cake) with a marshmellow-y fondant.
author: Anjali B.

description:
I stopped in and purchased a cake last minute for a birthday. The gentleman that helped me out was so sweet and wrote the birthday greeting for me still even though that takes a while. 

I didn't love the cake but that could have been because the birthday girl chose coconut and I don't like the flavor and found it dry. 

I'm definitely coming back to try the tarts and other cakes.
author: Emily H.

description: I ordered my wedding cake from here and was so happy with the results.  Earl is extremely helpful and knowledgeable.  I wasn't sure how big or small a cake I needed for our small wedding and he assured me that a two tier cake (6' and 8') would be plenty.  I showed him some Pinterest pics and he created the exact cake I dreamed!  He suggested I come in for a tasting and let me choose which flavors I wanted to try.  My maid of honor and I went in on a Saturday morning and there was so much cake!  We loved all the flavors and picked chocolate cake and a white cake with strawberry jam filling.  Our guests loved it!  The cake was delivered to our dinner reception location for a small fee and there were no issues in delivery.  The cake was reasonably priced and the service was excellent.  I should also add that because I forgot to confirm my order, my cake almost wasn't made.  I called Earl a week before my wedding just to confirm everything was still set and he didn't have the order, BUT assured me it wasn't an issue and delivered the cake on time!!
author: Theresa H.

description: I felt the need to write a review as I had such a TERRIBLE experience with Lotta's. I called this morning to reserve a challah for shabbat...the man on the phone (he works friday mornings) was rude and impatient with me from the start and all I asked was if I could pick up a challah. After reserving a Challah, I hung up and found out I would not be needing one after all and called back less than two minutes later to cancel my reservation. He answered and responded with "Great thanks for wasting my time!" and hung up on me.... I was in shock at his immaturity and unprofessionalism. I did not have to even call back to tell them to take the Challah off hold, but I did because I did not want them to waste it. NEVER will I go here again!
author: Maya B.

description: For any family occasion we always get a Princess cake. I gave Lotta's Bakery a shot since it's in a convenient location for me to pick up the cake. The 8" princess cake was so tall the box smushed the little decorative flower into itself, I was really impressed with the height and weight of it - they didn't skimp out at all!  It was a winner at the dinner table, everyone (even those that don't normally eat sweets) had at least a slice or two and everyone took some home with them! By far one of the better princess cakes in the city. I'll definitely go back.
author: Robyn K.

description:
I came here to get a few slices of cake for my dads birthday. They have a huge selection which can be overwhelming. I got the coconut frosted cake and a cake dipped in rum. The coconut frosted cake was perfect - moist, mildly sweet, light frosting, and fresh. We kept one slice in the fridge for my grandpa the next day and it was still good. The other selection was also newly baked. I appreciate their dedication to selling freshly made goods rather than resell old pastries which I have seen around the area. I was not a huge fan of the cake dipped in rum sauce. It was way too boozey and the cake becomes texture of mush. However, as a disclaimer,
I'm fickle with texture of food.
author: Rowena N.

description:
What a great eclectic place Lotta's Bakery is. Who would have ever thought to pair a bakery with some antiques?  We were looking for some treats for Thanksgiving and ended up getting a few different pieces of pies here.  They were good but nothing mouth shattering.

If you're into antiques and treats this is the place for you.
author: Blake B.

description:
This is not my first review of Lotta's -- I'm sure I reviewed them the first time I was there.  

I have been buying baked goods from Lotta's since they opened.  I love that they're an old fashioned bakery. Their prices are reasonable -- not like the fancy cupcake stores that have popped up all over the place and sell $5 cupcakes  I buy something yummy every weekend.  His pie crusts are flaky, even the next day.  The chicken pot pie is one of my favorites, but I tend to get more sweet than savory like apple strudel, fruit tarts, Hamantaschen, cookies, Lemon squares, Magic Bars (coconut, chocolate chip and pecans --not sure about pecan) on a thin cookie dough.  I've tried almost everything Earl bakes.

I recommend Lotta's to all my friends.
author: Lois L.

description:
Really nice service.
Good selection of cakes and pies. Not the same selection as other bakeries so you can find some unique items. 
The family raved about the Apple Cake that we selected - very moist, nice flavor.
author: Brad R.

description:
Sweet treats and antiques! I never thought I would find myself in a quirky antique shop that doubles as a bakery as suggested by the sign of the red jester doll sitting by the store's entrance. I felt like I was on-scene of the Pretty Little Liars show with the dolls and eccentric props. I decided to eat there and take it all in, spooking myself a little with my wild imagination.  

On to the desserts! I noticed they had a lot of Jewish pastries such as hamentasch and comfort desserts. They had four types of pie that day; all fruits: apple, cherry, blueberry, and blackberry. I got a slice of blueberry pie and a rustic berry tart. The pie was okay; lots o' crust which I like but it turned out to be slightly bland and thick/doughy. The crust of the rustic berry tart was another story - flaky, croissant-like with caramelized edges and bottom. It was topped with some streusel crumble and made with 3 types of berries!

They have small cookies for 60 cents each, great for sampling. I got their chocolate orange drop cookie, coconut cookie, and plain shortbread. The shortbread was too thin and not crunchy, but the other two were fantastic. They offer a dozen for $6.50 so I'll go for that next time. 

After finishing the goods, I decided 5 treats weren't enough and went back for two more. I had my eye set on the peanut butter cup, which was this adorable sugar covered peanut cookie with a drop of chocoolate in the middle. Unfortunately, it was too sweet and I wasn't a fan of the hard texture. I also got rugelach; I chose the one with the chocolate filling because that was unorthodox. It tasted more like a mini chocolate croissant, but I liked how flaky and soft it was. 

The young and bubbly girl working there at the time was great and answered all my questions. The baker himself who I saw decorating sugar cookies and talked to later on seemed like a lovely man who was into his work. I would definitely return to this bakery with a flair.
author: Alice L.

description: I ordered to 2  1/4 sheet cakes for two birthday parties happening the same day...the traditional chocolate and the red velvet.  I have never used their bakery or tasted any thing from them but I saw all the great reviews and decided to give it a shot.  Both cakes were excellent but the chocolate was my favorite!  I will definitely be using Lotta's for future parties!
author: LaKiesha H.

description: Earl has done it again. amazing amazing amazing cake for my sister's bridal shower. Cream cheese frosting is to die for and the prices are very reasonable. Thanks again!
author: maria k.

description:
I had time to kill before dinner at 1760 so walked around this area -- cute area -- and this place caught my eye.  

Love the concept!  Love the antiques.  Loved the full-body dog costume until I tried it on and it didn't fit . . . very, very sad about that . . . 

So I consoled myself by buying a dozen cookies and they were DELICIOUS.  The baked goods are SO GOOD.  This place is an absolute treasure.  

Now I must find somewhere else to buy a dog costume.
author: Karen r.

description: A very small and unique bakery with all sorts of nick naks. I almost missed it because it didn't look like a bakery from the outside. Ordered the classic apple pie and the seasonal blackberry pie. The apple pie was not bad..just decent. 5 stars for the blackberry pie! It is so moist and not overwhelmingly sweet, which is great for my Asian palette. The man who helped us was very nice.
author: Rosanna T.

description:
-- Pie to die for --

Came in on a rainy Saturday 

Apple pie ***** 5 stars!

Pecan pie 5 more! 

Great small shop with adequate seating space 

Last their cakes look amazing
author: Evan W.

description: What an awesome place! Antiques and Bakery in one tiny store... Who could ask for anything more. Talked with one of the owner for about 10 minutes and he was so great. The pastries were awesome!!!! Just loved this place. If you're in the neighborhood make sure to stop by. We will definitely be back!
author: Jamie S.

description:
Lotta's Bakery is a cute little bakery in SF, tucked away in the Nob Hil neighborhood (right by Swan's Oyster Depot, so make sure you come here if you are eating at Swan's. Or better yet, pick up a snack from Lotta's while you're waiting in line). I got there 20 minutes before they closed on a Saturday, and there were still plenty of people hanging out inside the bakery. I purchased:

-Strawberry Yogurt Cake ($3.80, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lottas-bakery-san-francisco?select=jM_kCM8ypMmUj7EXrgItXg#jM_kCM8ypMmUj7EXrgItXg): Yum! There was a little tang from the yogurt, but the cake was really moist, and the strawberries were really good. They also gave me a big slice, so recommended! I also loved that they will sell their customers a whole pie for $24, but have a sign that says they will slice any pie.
-Shortbread Cookie ($0.65, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lottas-bakery-san-francisco?select=jM_kCM8ypMmUj7EXrgItXg#ho-pDnKqfFEjRlR521S5sQ): Yum! The cookie was buttery tasting but still light and crisp. Recommended!
-Coconut Almond Cookie ($0.65, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lottas-bakery-san-francisco?select=jM_kCM8ypMmUj7EXrgItXg#K0Kd1k3q3DJpfxqIU9gkWw): Just ok. There was more coconut flavor than almond, and I think they needed to make the cookie bigger to have both flavors come through.

Cookies are $0.65 or $6.50/dozen, so you get 2 free if you purchase 10. The girl who was helping me was really nice, and super patient answering all my questions about the different items. My only criticism is that they need more labels for the items! None of the cookies were labeled, so you have to ask them what each flavor is (and they have 10+ varieties so it can take a little while). I felt like I would have purchased additional items if I knew what everything was. In any case, I will have to come back to Lotta's during the summer when they have more berry pies available! There are also a few tables inside the bakery for you to sit down and eat your items in if you'd like. Parking in this area was easy to find around 5pm on a Saturday, but all the street parking spots are metered.
author: Amy D.

description: Lottas bakery has the finest  gingerbread molasses cake I have ever had or ever conceived of. I stop by about once a month.   Everybody should try this at least once in their short life
author: bill h.

description: The pastries (chocolate brownies) here are legit. I haven't tried too many of their pastries but I'm sure to come back for more!
author: Julie C.

description:
A quirky little store that's part bakery, part antiques shop. Depending on which owner you ask, either the bakery or the antiques shop is the primary business of the venue.

Dropping in after a stopping at Bob's across the street (yes, I know, I tend to binge buy when it comes to baked goods), I perused their offerings briefly and decided to pick up four of their cookies: shortbread, oatmeal raisin, Mexican wedding cake, and double ginger, at $0.65 per (alternatively, you can get a dozen for just $6.50 - essentially two free cookies). 

Overall, not bad, not great. My favorite of the bunch was easily the oatmeal raisin, followed by the shortbread (one of the lighter-tasting varieties I've had though), ginger, and Mexican wedding cake.

Worth dropping in on if you're already in the area, but I don't really see myself craving them enough to make a trip of it. Bob's on the other hand... I can see myself possibly stopping by after fulfilling a doughnut craving. 

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - No problems with accessibility here, as long as you're just here for the baked goods. If you're here to do some antiques shopping, I suspect there may be some difficulties navigating, as the back seemed a bit more cramped (but I didn't actually check them out to verify).

Bathroom - I'm not really sure if they even had any.
author: Johnny W.

description: I absolutely love this bakery it's one of my top bakeries to go to!! I have an extremely bad sweet tooth and when I want a really good fix I go here cause it's just so damn good. A few of my favorite pastries from here are 1). Buba A rum, it's so fluffy and delicious 2). Bread pudding! Wow it's fantastic! 3). There lemon squares are to die for also highly recommended. Not just cause they have great pastries I rate them five stars also their  service is great the gentleman that work as bakers and ringers are all very sweet and friendly I love browsing at the antique section also great deal for your buck. This is truly a San Francisco gem.
author: Josh R.

description:
Wow!  What a great place!  My daughter had a birthday, and I Lotta's came to the rescue!!!!!!!  Folks, absolutely unbelievable customer service and great folks all around.
I had some 'other' Bakery let me down and they had a cake ready, and delivered in less than an hour!
THANK YOU so much for allowing me from far away, to still make her day special.
Folks whether you are in SanFrancisco,,,,or out of town - highly recommend!
author: Beth F.

description: The owner is a 10! The Thomas the Train cake he did for our son's 2nd birthday was amazing!  It looked fantastic and was absolutely delicious! It was a huge hit at the party!  He also made cupcakes for the party that were so yummy! We wanted to go with a local place for this occasion and we are so happy we did.  The prices were reasonable and so worth it.  The order process was super easy: we called, we sent some pictures for ideas, we came in, discussed and ordered.  Then the day of the party we picked up, right on time, everything was ready to go.  Great transaction.  We definitely recommend and will be going here for future events! Overall great experience!
author: Diana P.

description: This is such an amazing hidden gem. Great coffee, baked goods, and quirky rare findings. What a great combination.
author: Pablo S.

description:
I had a gift certificate I'd been putting off using for a special occasion. Finally I went for a pie on 3/14. Get it?... Pi?... 3.14... ANYWAY...

The owner is such a sweet man. We first met over the phone when I called ahead to see what they offered in the way of pies. As soon as I heard "pecan pie" I was sold (though I must say now I want to try the lemon meringue). I drove over and luckily found a parking spot right in front of the shop. Polk can be tough sometimes!

The storefront is adorably decorated with vintage/antique trinkets and nic-nacs and photos of dames of the past like Marylin Monroe. Super charming. There are two display cases filled with delicious pastries, cookies and much more! I had come for the pie, but also added a cheddar onion scone and a couple wedding cookies (my fave) for just a few more bucks. I'm so glad I did!

Pecan Pie: buttery, rich, flaky pie crust, unlike anything I've ever tasted. Perfectly toasted pecan chunks on top, with a filling of brown sugar and caramel flavors. I already really like pecan pie, but this one? IT'S LOVE.

Cheddar Onion Scone: Fluffy, yet holds its structure well. I ate it the next morning, toasted, sliced in half with scrambled egg in the middle. So so tasty, and way up there on my scone list. Scones are meant to be soft and delicious, not brick blocks of flour. Lotta's scones I'll be back for for sure. 

Mexican Wedding Cookies: Also a fave of mine to start, and these did NOT disappoint. Super rich and buttery and the walnuts! OH the deliciously decadent walnuts. 

Pretty sure I've found my new favorite bakery.
author: Meredith S.

description: I love Lotta's!  The proprietors ("The Baker and the Antique Guy") are the most talented, gracious and personable fellows.  The confections and antiques make this a must stop on Polk.  However,  I have just learned of a NEW treat there: the Chicken Pot Pies that are  baked from scratch (with love!) only on Saturdays.  $6.00 each.  OMG!   Although I like Mollie Stone's for some salads...I've noticed that their Chicken Pot Pies are 8.99 and look like a baby elephant's toe nail!  No bueno.  RUN to Lotta's!  You will be glad you did!
author: Patrick J.

description:
I really can't rave enough about Lotta's! Around 7 months before our wedding, we walked by their store on Polk St and took a flyer. After seeing their SUPER reasonable prices, we booked a cake tasting.

We tasted the Strawberry Cream, German Chocolate, and Princess Cakes.... And fell in love with all three!

We decided to go with a "presentation" princess cake for the grooms, and Earl was able to duplicate the photo we brought in pretty much exactly.

For the rest of the guests, we got a 1/2 sheet of the two other types of cake.

Everything was perfectly on time, Earl was amazing about communicating with us, just super friendly & professional throughout the whole thing.

Plus, it was incredibly affordable.

I will give Lotta's as much business as I can in the future!
author: Will C.

description: Good apple pie, but crust need more butter to get that true flavor and flakey-ness.
author: Anthony W.

description:
I have ordered a few bespoke things from here and all have been incredible. 

We've had a multi-layered raspberry chocolate cake with adorable garnishes on top that was soooo delicious - made for an office birthday celebration

4 dairy free (and I found out later - vegan!) chocolate cupcakes for a small family holiday celebration that were ah-ma-zing! We're not vegans but who would care if all vegan food tasted like these!?

I'm also expecting a couple of cakes for tomorrow and am so excited to taste those too! 

Oh, and the antiques are adorable. The prices are reasonable. The staff and customer service are really just fine - 1 of the 2 gentlemen that works there is quite accommodating and sweet. The other one does a fine job too. 

I have been told that they can make all kinds of custom things, the trick is to call several days ahead and they will cheerfully and expertly make whatever you want. 

I'll keep going back over and over.
author: Katie C.

description: Very good bakery and the owner is an absolute love. Very kind and light-hearted. Everything we tried was good and I noticed that everything was very European in that there were no strong, overpowering flavors. Nothing was very sweet, which is what my pallet is used to. I appreciate Los the more simple flavors and high quality.
author: Melissa D.

description:
I've been wanting to try Lotta's for quite sometime now, but late riser me seems to never make it there before their 3pm closing time on Sundays. Luckly, much to my excitement today I woke up at a decent hour and took a short walk down to Lotta's.  I was mesmerized by all the treats as I walked in.

I knew for sure I was getting the bread pudding plus whatever else struck my fancy. WRONG... I ended up not getting the bread pudding because just as I was about to say, "one bread pudding please" a little fly landed on top of it! Maybe it's me being overly sensitive, but I had to chage me choice. I ended up with the mixed berry tart, that the fly probably landed on also and the coconut shortbread and Mexican wedding cookie.

The berry tart was yummy and I'm going to try other cookies on my next visit.
author: Jennie N.

description:
I didn't recall seeing this bakery before, but judging by the Yelp reviews it's been here for awhile.  There's even a red Yelp sticker on the door.  From the outside looking in I noticed there was nobody inside, but even by looking through the glass door the beautifully decorated baked goods in a pastry case and behind a glass counter caught my attention and drew me in.  I was so taken by the assortment of the cookies, breads and cakes I didn't notice the antique items for sale until I stood before the cash register.

I purchased only a small number of items just as a snack to take on CalTrain for my ride down to the Sharks game.  

The miniature lemon meringue tarts (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/L-P-Vqy45mTOeYUdLjyMfQ?select=sl-Lm-CdXLg7K5S6YlGJGQ) caught my attention immediately.  There are two sizes.  One is about three inches in diameter and the other is about an inch.  Had I known these were so good I would have taken the larger size over the mini size.  In fact, I thought these were excellent.  Over-filled in a thin shortbread crust is a tart and tangy lemon curd topped off by a swirl of fluffy, sweet meringue.  It was a bit on the sweet side, but isn't that why we eat dessert?  The little minis were only $1.25 each.

The chocolate orange drop cookies (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/L-P-Vqy45mTOeYUdLjyMfQ?select=OroPpqXUePs8yxi0uxMBbg) were very good.  These were almost as chewy as a chocolate brownie.  Topped with a sprinkle of powdered sugar there was significant orange essence noticeable with every bite.

The peanut butter cookies (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/L-P-Vqy45mTOeYUdLjyMfQ?select=6XkasOvw-DCtuW5j1yVF0Q) were very good too.  They had good peanut butter taste with just the right amount of saltiness to sweetness, and they were moist and crumbly.  If you're like me and not a fan of crunchy peanut butter and prefer not to have chopped peanuts in your cookies, these would be a good choice for you too.

The checkerboard shortbread cookies (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/L-P-Vqy45mTOeYUdLjyMfQ?select=OCQmIoURm5ovj5nFB-rC6w) was the only selection that did not thrill me.  The cookies looked fine but tasted boring with not enough butter or shortening, and in my opinion, not enough sugar.  I'll pass on these next time.

55 cents per cookie, but I think there is another price if you're not buying just individual cookies.  The woman that helped me was very nice and very patient as I peered through the glass display uncertain of what I wanted to try.  I'll be back for more.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Very quaint little location, definitely has a very homey/friendly ambiance to it (complemented by the antique store towards the back.)

The gingerbread is definitely one of the better ones around; it is VERY gingery/spicy, much more authentic than what you would get at a supermarket. The cheese scone was very light and great small snack, and the double chocolate cookie was phenomenal.
author: Landon E.

description:
I and my husband have visited Lotta's Bakery quite a few times and.we love the neighborhood and the antiques and have brought a few pieces. How nice we can have coffee and pastry and browse the antiques. We love the ambiance and the very friendly staff and owners.. It feels at home there. 
Now, the pastries are nothing short of amazing, baked to perfection. The cakes, cookies, biscotti and pies are also scrumptious and if you need a wedding cake, this is the place! Also, the prices are reasonable. So, enjoy!  We always do when we visit.
author: Donna C.

description: We ordered a red velvet cake for my moms 60th birthday from Lotta's based on all of the reviews. It was beautiful, but the flavor was disappointing. The cake was very bland and the icing just tasted like butter. Pretty bummed...
author: Courtney O.

description:
I was trying my best to eat healthy this week.

Salads. No sweets. No fried foods. No heavy creams. Lots of fruit...

until I had to run an errand on Polk street and spied Lotta's Bakery.

I only went inside to browse.

To peruse the rows of decadent baked goods and pastries.

I kindly thanked the warm people behind the counter, and was on my way out -  when I saw it.

A simple sign which neatly read - "Honey Cake."

Being polite - I commented on it.

"Yum - Honey Cake. Sounds good. Trying to be healthy - but I will definitely have to come back for that."

I smiled real big and made my way to the door, when the gentleman behind the counter - wiped his hands on his apron and jovially yelled after me.

"Unfortunately it won't be here next week. It was made specially for Rosh Hashanah.

I stopped. Took one real long hard look at that oh so sweet pastry. That limited edition masterpiece - and a defeated look crossed my face.

"ahhhhhhhh  - I was trying so hard to be healthy, but I'll take one Honey Cake then, please."

They cut me off a massive slice of freshly made, moist honey cake.

It was lovely. The perfect thing to satiate my sweet cravings and I made sure to share it with my co-workers as well.

Lotta's - a solid spot for sugar cravings - after you've picked up a sandwich from Miller's Deli.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
FABULOUS PIE!!! 
When it comes to pie, it's all about the pie crust and NOBODY does pie crust better than Lotta's!  The bottom crust is crunchy.  Always!  Never soggy.  That alone makes every pie delicious to the max.  I have tried the  pumpkin, pecan and have special ordered the most scrumptious banana cream pie (twice! because once was NOT enough!)  I've even bought an empty crust to fill with my own filling.  Wonderful and glorious.   Next I am going to try the lemon meringue.  Earl also has excellent cookies and very tasty coconut macaroons.     But I can't say enough about the PIE!!!!
If you LOVE pie, you will LOVE Lotta's!
author: Kassy A.

description:
I love the pies from Lotta's Bakery and often get them for get togethers with friends. I always get asked where the pies are from, since they are so good and fresh. 

I tried their chicken pot pie for the first time the other day, and was blown away. It was so flavorful, with the right balance of chicken and veggies. 

Lastly, the service at Lotta's is always great. I have had a positive experience with the friendly people working there every time I go, and I stop by at least once a month!
author: Yuki S.

description: Oh.my.gawd.  The rum cake!  Perfect blend of rum and syrup, but not too sweet.  Soooo tasty.  We also got the bread pudding but had to immediately write this Yelp review as the rum cake was incredible.  You can tell that everything is carefully handmade.  Such a cute little cafe!
author: Nicole K.

description:
It is a very cute store.  I tried the following:
Strawberry/cherry tart  not crunchy enough:  3
Pecan pie -- the pecans fell apart not enough "glue", but I liked it a lot as it was not too sweet and had a crispy crust:  4 
Lemon Meringue Pie - PERFECT crunchy crust that was golden brown, but it was a bit too sweet, thus:  4.5.  I would come back for this alone.

They over charged me by $3 and did not get an apology from the lady that did it for having to come back to the store. However, the gentleman that handed me back the money did.  Pay attention to the charges.
author: A D.

description: Baba au rhum and bread pudding are delicious. But how about some silverware? Your an antique store and I have to take down this great big eggy moist slice of bread pudding with a plastic fork? The plastic fork can break trying to eat the Baba or Bread Pudding.
author: Devin S.

description: I have not even stepped foot in this bakery but I am reviewing simply on the customer service I had on the phone today. I called to ask about cake prices for my mom's birthday and whoever answered the phone today (6/18, around 1:00 pm) was very rude and hung up the phone so quickly without saying "Thanks" or "Bye". Sorry but you just lost a potential customer and I will be taking my business else where!
author: Kimberly T.

description:
Delicious!I love you I love you I love you so much I had to more far far away from to to prevent.... Think the worse!

I love this place. The manager is so nice and talented. They have the best shortbread cookies I've tried period. I will never of course tell my grandma this... I think she has a yelp acct as well... lol I've had their bread pudding here very yummy. The PB and mexican wedding cookies.... The pumpkin bread is very good. The lemon tarts sell out everyday by noon probably still that way till this day, so sad as I've never been able to eat one, because they always were sold out. You can also order a cheesecake which you cannot by a slice prior to taste, but buy in confidence one of the best cheesecakes I've had in a longtime.

Love you Lotta's, When in the city I vow to come by :)
author: Dominique M.

description:
HAVE YOU HAD THE MOLASSES BREAD?
Delightful bakery goods I'd recommend the world over. Literally, everything I've tried here is beyond my expectations of delicious, moist (yes, I said it) cakey sweetness. And reasonably priced.
Ah bawg gawd. Seriously.

The antiques are cute, and fun to look at.

My "adorable anecdote" (I won't be offended if this isn't useful to you)
When I first came here, my friend and I were peeking around and kind of stumbled into the kitchen to meet the owner/baker who runs this place with his partner (who does the antiques) He showed us around and talked a little bit about how he got started and in general was extremely nice and welcoming to some drowsy spring chickens (my friend and me, 20ish tourists) He bakes all the goods, which I didn't know were so spectacular at the time, but the story was great.
So cute, my heart melts a little bit.
author: Leah Q.

description:
I love going here for an afternoon coffee, pastry and peaceful atmosphere.  
The art deco antiques keep my eyes busy and gratified.  
My taste buds are crying out; "give me one of everything!" 
I've always felt welcome and valued.
Of course, I can't help myself, always get something to eat later at home and you will, too.
author: Corinne d.

description: Yes! Yes! Yes! Everything we had was good: bread , udding, pecan tassies, 3 different cookies, (shortbread which was not my fav or the 3 and sugar and snickerdoddle) cream cheese brownie, did I say bread pudding because its phenomenal. The service was great and I will definitely be stopping back by often... I have to thabj yelp for steering me to them. GO!! You will NOTreget it
author: Jessica K.

description: Hands down best chocolate cake ever! You and your guests will not be sorry. I'm not a cake person, but this is amazing! Been going here for 3 years & highly recommend!
author: Lindsey R.

description: I really love this place! I thought the set up of antique store plus bakery was quite unique. We didn't buy any antiques but we sure did buy lots of baked goods. So far I have eaten the Rum Baba.. which is like a cake bun in rum sauce.. really really really really good!!! I am totally going back and buying a dozen of those LOL. Geesh I forget the names of the others but apple tart I think, chocolate mound thingie, meringue cookie sandwich with chocolate in the middle (yum!), apricot tarts covered in chocolate.. yes we bought a lot! And we wanted to buy even more! It's ok we live just a few blocks away from Polk so we can come back anytime! Oh and total was $18 for everything.. unbelievable!! I am in love.
author: Vol T.

description:
I wandered into Lotta's almost by accident. I had some time to kill and my eye was drawn to their pink sign. the word "bakery" sealed the deal. I planned to just window shop, so I hesitated outside the door intending to read the menu. The man sweeping the stoop caught my eye and invited me in. It turns out, he's the owner and does all the baking. There were all kinds of lovely things to choose from. Bread pudding, slices of pie, gorgeous cupcakes, and a pastry that I think was swimming in rum. Basically, it was everything your Eastern European Grandmother would make and then some. 

I ended up buying a cheese & scallion scone for myself, chocolate rugelagh for my mother, and a rocky road brownie for the friend I was meeting. My scone was buttery, flaky and light with a lovely cheese flavor. My friend's brownie looked wonderful and disappeared in record time. 

Delicious baked goods are only half the story. They also have antiques. I didn't explore much, but there were definitely interesting things. Really lovely interesting things. I have to say, Lotta's is truly unique. 

If you are in Nob Hill shopping on Polk Steet stop in and see what you can find. I plan to go back and try one of those rum things.
author: Nicole M.

description:
The molasses gingerbread here is like crack, only in a good way. It's good fresh, and even better just a little bit stale. Chewy, spicy, rich, delicious. 

I ordered one of their strawberry shortcakes for a birthday and it was simply delish.
author: Roxmarie M.

description: I only write reviews for places I absolutely love or absolutely hate.   Lotta's is fantastic.  The only bakery I go to.  I won't tell you my favorite items as I don't want you to go and buy them out before I get there.  Irt's all great so just go and try it out!
author: Mike F.

description: A lovely little bakery nestled between shops on the busy Polk st. If you have a specific cake, pastry, or pie in mind, you can call the store in advance to place a custom order. Very good prices. A great variety of over the counter treats.
author: Amy M.

description: Yes! Randomly stumbled here but am so glad I did! Lotta is so sweet and friendly and her baked goods are outstanding! There must have been at least 10 different unique cookies and priced at only 60 cents each, you can be sure I ordered at least half a dozen just for myself. I also tried the cheddar and onion scone which was delicious as well.
author: Tiffany F.

description: How can you not love this place!?! But more importantly how you you not love Richard and Earl!?! Lottas is a place that you know everytime you come in you will leave with more than you expected and with a big smile.
author: Trevor D.

description: Awesome little shop!  They had pumpkin pie when every other bakery I called didn't.  They also have some amazing other desserts!  One comment though: they should display their food in the window, and then their popularity would sky rocket because people would see the awesome goods as they walk by, the shop is easy to miss walking by.
author: James M.

description:
Classic SF-P.A., (p.a. stands for passive agg.) Seriously I've been there 50 times over and always say hello to you Mr. 1/2 bald white hair mustache baker.

Today I tie my Great Dane to the locked door handle and stepped inside. I wait and wait to be served because one customer is buying art from your walls and as I am waiting for my change you run out of the back past me and though I smile and say hello, you blow by me and go to my dog and shoo her from the doorway. 

Never mind that my dog is on a short leash and only had her head in the doorway. Never mind that it was the previous customer who stopped in the doorway and was petting my Dane thus causing her head to be in the view of the door opening. Never mind that other three customers sitting at the table inside were calling to my dog and bemoaning the fact that she can't come in. Never mind that you are a D**K for assuming a dog is somehow the blame and for what, for being a sweet gentle creature who was patiently waiting OUTSIDE your business. 

 Yea, I like your sweets, but hey your attitude is what IS being baked into them and I tossed your apricot bar into the compost bin because frankly it's about heart and you haven't got one.

 So, I am not giving you one star because then I would be a SFPA wisenheimer 2! 

I hope you read this, because you'll see me on the street and wonder why I don't buy your pastries any longer  and then also when you wonder why I tell you to your face to get bent, you won't be surprised.
author: Nik D.

description: Earl's goods aren't to shabby at all. His cookies are yummy adn even sweeter than his goods is his philantrophy and his attitude. Admittedly, his cookies are more crisp and saltier than other shops, but overall they're yummy.
author: R C.

description:
Lotta's bakery is super cute. When you walk in two dapper gentlemen greet you with a very friendly but heavily laced sarcastic banter. I am a bantering champion, a winner of many grungy dumpstered medals of such a sport. These older gentlemen have been crafting their skills for years and the ride is so smooth (you must be a limousine?).

In the back of Lotta's is an antique store crammed with many wondrous delights. My sweet pal Lucky swooned over a couple of vintage pink lamps until we were both tickled by a cartoon finger that lead our floating bodies to the pastry case. 

We filled a small box to take home, including a small yellow iced duck cookie for our buddy. Lotta's makes a damn good cookie. Holla.
author: Alysia A.

description:
I'm so happy we stumbled upon Lotta's Bakery while running some wedding errands in the city.  I was craving something sweet and Lotta's Bakery hit the spot!

Interior: cozy, super cute, pink, antique elegance
Customer Service: warm and welcoming
Value: cheap and you get more than what you pay for

They have a wide array of desserts - cupcakes, cookies, pastries, bread pudding, coffee cake, cinnamon buns, macaroons, cake, muffins, & even dog biscuits.  

I only planned to get 1 thing but I walked out with 3.  The coffee cake was delectable. My favorite was the glorious serving of bread pudding which was made of their cinnamon buns. (yup, I asked because I am a bread pudding freak)  The other dessert I tried was a small roll filled with raspberry, no idea what they call it but it was equally delicious as it looked.  I wish I would've bought more!
author: Nikki C.

description:
parking...hmm, go around the block and maybe you'll find some.

I generally don't talk about service unless its a BIG DEAL or its HORRIBLE.  In this case, if its slow and the lady(maybe the owner) is reading the newspaper at one of the tables...she won't get up until you show interest in buying something.  If you're still looking she's going to still be sitting.  No Complaint by me...just an observation.

So i took a strawberry pastry but didn't ask what its called but it tasted DELICIOUS!  Cooked the way i wanted and the portion in the middle.  If you want the crust or edge...they have that too.

My mom took the strawberry/rasberry tart..it was DELICIOUS!  

The place is ALSO an ANTIQUE shop...so you can look around to see the things you might have had when you were younger...or buy it just because you've always wanted one.  I saw some things that I haven't remembered in YEARS.  I wonder if mine are worth as much as she's selling them for.

Give this place a go.  Its cute, it tastes great.
author: Bing D.

description:
I ordered twice by phone at Lotta's Bakery and each time it was on a special day (24th and 31st of December). They reserved the cakes and I could pick them up later during the day before 5pm. The staff is very kind and of a good advice when you hesitate between several choices.

Now about the cakes. They were wonderful, tasting great and more importantly to me, not heavy at all on the stomach for what I ordered (one of them was a cheesecake). I definitely recommend trying Lotta's, they are worth it!
author: Emmanuel C.

description:
Lotta's has the best black Molasses ginger bread I have ever had. Just the right amount of moist, real molasses and real ginger. it taste's like how my momma use to make it from the South. I make mine stickier and if they did that I would be in heaven but amazing taste and texture. My next favorite is the fruit gazettes. They melt in your mouth. The fruit be it berries or peaches or apples somehow taste authentic unlike canned versions. Also, the pumking bread is pretty tasty. Wish it was more on the moist side.

The best by far is the au rum balls. OMG, sheer heaven decadence. I could eat 5 but tend to get only one as it is so rich enshrouded in rum sauce. so much sauce left over I will pour on the on the pumpkin bread which then makes it moist. Crafty me. The handmake cakes (chocolate ribbon, marzipan) are to die for. Words cannot describe the myriad of flavors mixed together in every bite. The atmosphere is quaint with antiques around you. The french roast coffee isnt my favorite and wish there was a mixed blend, holiday blend or italian roast. For this bakery I suggest Philz or Four Barrel. The proprieter is a lovely man who knows culture, desserts and everything travel. He is engaging and down to earth. My fave little dessert place on Polk. Open til 5 weeks days. Thanks Lotta's :)
author: Michael D.

description:
Lotta's is a super cute place. Lots of atmosphere and the girl behind the counter was a sweetheart. Everything looked extremely tasty, especially the pies, but I was excited to see rugelach and hammentaschen... I got one each of the raspberry and apricot rugelach and a cheddar onion scone.

The cookies, while tasty, were made with a sort of puff pastry dough rather than the dense pastry I'm used to... they were more like mini rolled danish, but again, they tasted really good. The scone was definitely a biscuit, rather than a scone, sort of fluffy, but the flavor was wonderful with just a hint of the bite that cheddar can give savory pastry. Super mild.

I'm excited to try more things here!
author: Allie D.

description:
Recently I ordered a wedding cake from Lotta's Bakery.  We priced out a few places and Lotta's was reasonably priced.  It was two large tiers with beautiful flowers on it to serve about 30 people, but we ended up with quite a lot extra.  The cake was lovely - exactly what we asked for.  We worked with Earl who was extremely easy to work with - his e-mail communication was prompt.

The cake we choose was the chocolate espresso mousse, which was not exactly my thing, but our guests and my husband LOVED it.  The only thing I could improve on would be the flavors.  I would have loved a carrot cake or so.  I didn't think the other flavors we tried were that delicious (lemon was good, the white cake was just okay).

I would definitely go here again - they make beautiful, elegant cakes at a reasonable price and are very easy to work with.
author: Chelsea K.

description: I love pastries..especially cookies and brownies.  The cinnamon roll was okay, nothing special.double chocolate chip cookies didnt taste chocolatey at all..salty in fact..and the brownie was eh..not sure what ingredients they're using but I questioned whether I was treating myself or punishing with some health food.
author: Ghezal O.

description:
Mini lemon meringue for $3.75

Good beyond belief. This place is waaaaaaay too close to my house. 

The pastry chef was very polite and nice to us even though I didn't place a huge order. 

DEFINITELY going back.
author: Carlos A.

description:
After being fed up with Whole Foods's stale cookies for $1-1.25 a piece. (Even the ones in the "freshly baked" area are hard, what gives?) 
Anyways, I decided to grab some cookies from here. DELICIOUS chocolate chip cookie for only 65 cents a piece. I only give it 4 stars because I like my cookies to be very chewy and it wasn't the best cookie I ever had. But, I will definitely come back when I need a cookie fix and to try the brownies.
author: Bellal N.

description: Found myself with a rare, free 1/2 hour and fell into Lotta's Bakery. I was attracted by the sweet pink and white awning and the 'arts and antiques' sign. It all looked very Parisian. I wasn't disappointed. I was served a hot french press coffee and a chocoate base macaroon for the grand total of $3.15. The heck w/Starbucks (& Peet's) when you can sit for a quiet moment, do a little writing and be enchanted by old music and a stunning array of baked goods. Recommend!
author: joan g.

description: Super-creative clever bakers -- made an amazing cake requested by my-son-the-best-man for his brother's bachelor party.  It was tastefully lewd and VERY tasty!  The request was for something they'd never created but they did it -- fun and funny.  (All their creations are delicious ...)
author: Em C.

description: Customer service is lacking. I called in to potentially place an order, for the following day, half an hour before Lotta's posted closing time. When I informed the gentleman on the phone that I was calling around for prices I was told that he was closing up shop and I could leave a message for him to receive tomorrow and he promptly hung up. The desserts look great, but if you are looking for better service, there are better places in town.
author: Lauren N.

description:
It's humble, it's quiet, and it has everything you want from cakes to cookies to pies to my favorite, their bread pudding.

Cupcake alert: Don't come here for cupcakes because it's far from the trendy and delicious bakeries that specializes in cupcakes, but if you must, go ahead and order one to see for yourself.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
We stopped by here after eating at Miller's deli across the street.  I can say I only liked one of the 4 items we tried and that was the coconut shortbread cookie.  It wasn't too sweet, lots of coconut in it.
The red velvet cupcake $3, was very dry.  The cream cheese dollop on top was quite good but the cupcake wasn't.  
The coconut macaroon (sans chocolate) was cold, refrigerator cold.  I guess it was premade and then pulled out of the fridge.  The bottom had this gooey fluid.  Definitely a no-no.  A macaroon should have a nice and dry, crispy or crunchy exterior, not wet.

Lastly, we took home an apple pie for $18.  The pie looked good with a crust that stuck up so high like a chef's torque.  But, when sliced into it, the insides were flat like a pancake.  The apple filling inside was so overbaked that it was like pulp without any semblance of apple slices.  The flavor was good, but it clearly was overbaked.  I didn't like the crust either.  Sort of soft in the center and the edges, where the thickest part of the pie is, was too hard to eat.  It's like the crust I used to make when I first started to learn how to make pies.  

The clerk was really nice and the bakery serves as a 1/2 antique store.  Can't figure out how you can sell old dusty stuff along side with food.  The food is displayed nicely, too bad our choices disappointed.
author: Ry T.

description:
Give yourself plenty of time when you go (and you should). There are so many cookies, brownies and other baked assorted baked goodness to choose from you'll need a few minutes to figure out what you want.

After much deliberation, I went with an orange chocolate cookie. One bite later it became an outstanding orange chocolate cookie. And since it was less than a buck, the final name I'm giving it is a cheap outstanding orange chocolate cookie.
author: Jason B.

description: We needed a quicky wedding cake for the gallery (these things happen) and ran to Lotta's to get one of Earl's chocolate ganache cakes.  It was SO GOOD.  I'm still thinking about the nut layer on the bottom of the cake, which complemented the chocolate so very well.  And really, it was a deal when I realized how many people we served.  My husband really liked the pretty chocolate curls, which actually looked AND tasted good.  This is our new go-to cake.
author: Jennifer F.

description: I was hoping the quality of the desserts were as good as their presentation, but after a few experiences with stale product we've decided to pass this shop by. We did have good gingerbread here once, but the quality is inconsistent unfortunately.
author: Lord F.

description:
I stumbled upon his little gem over the weekend with my bff. Lotta's is a unique little store that is part bakery part antique shop. In here you'll find everything from old record players to hamatashen.

I got a slice of apple pie, a lemon bar, and a dog cookie (because dogs like cookies too!). I thought the lemon bar was my favorite. It was really tart and sweet at the same time and the crust was perfectly buttery. The apple pie was okay in my mind. The filling was pretty good, but the crust was okay. I can't tell you how the dog cookie was; but, my dogs would give it two paws up!
author: Angela L.

description:
Apparently the most popular items in this bakery is the coconut macaroons and the chocolate brownie with cream cheese so I bought them both.  One of each for $4.25, I think.  The macaroons are AMAZING.  So moist and chewy and coconutty and delicious.  The brownie was alright, it was $3 for a bar.  I enjoyed the macaroon better.  The older gentleman who worked there was super nice.  I'm going back for Valentine's Day.

(They have a huge array of baked goods: biscotti, whole pies, fruit tarts, cookies, et).
author: Walerz B.

description:
I once tried to start a Yelp conversation on Lemon Meringue Pie, and only got like one reply.  I was so disconsolate.  No fans of Lemon Meringue Pie in SF, that must mean that there's no demand.  And if there's no demand, then there can be no supply.  I trudged around SF for days wondering how to carry on.  Homeless guys offered me money, I looked so bad.

Then, one afternoon, I passed by Lotta's, and the sun came out.

As the great Hal David might have written: 

"If you see me walking down the street, 
And I start to cry, no lemon meringue pie,
Don't walk on by.
Just send me to Lotta's"
author: Nick J.

description:
I went looking for Bon Bon Patisserie the other day. I got lost, and ended up wandering around in the rain for a bit before finding it... to find it closed.

So I ended up in the Nob Hill area (I moved to San Francisco only a few months ago, so Nob Hill is the only area I'm relatively familiar with), knowing there were lots of European bakery's in there.

After wandering around in the rain for another 2 hours, unable to find a good bakery with lots of sweets, I came across Lotta's. 

It seemed so promising! The store was gorgeous, and the lady behind the counter was incredibly polite and friendly. I wasn't familiar with many of the Russian items, and she was more than happy to repeat the names and explain how they were cooked.

Originally, I just wanted to buy my friend a cupcake for her birthday.

So I purchased a chocolate cupcake with butter cream frosting and a red velvet cupcake with butter cream frosting.

I went back home and ate the chocolate cupcake... AND IT WAS SO DISAPPOINTING. The frosting was too light and airy. It had a nice taste, though. The cake was mediocre.

Not wanting to give my friend a blah present, I ate the red velvet one too. This was even worse than the chocolate cupcake. 

It was just too average, too mediocre, and they were too small for their price.
author: Nicole L.

description:
Adorable, cozy, and girly interior decorating.  Very friendly and nice asian lady working the register.

I got 2 cookies - chocolate chip and mexican wedding.  Awesome pricing (55 cents per cookie) allows for you to try a couple of different flavors.

The cookies weren't stale, and the texture was fine/good, but that is all the compliments I can give them besides looking tasty.  The problem was that neither cookie dough actually had any flavor!  They both just tasted like shortening.  Def not worth the calories, and not enjoyable to eat :(

I wonder if other dessert products in the shop are better?  The cupcakes didn't look appetizing, and the lady who worked there didn't have any recommendations, so for now, unless I hear of something specific that is great from here, not going back.
author: Ali G.

description: Look no further if you're on the hunt for some good old fashioned bread pudding. Lotta's gives you a dense, crusty topping followed by a creamy, custardy center. It's the kind of rich, hearty pudding I imagine an old world, European grandma serving.
author: Aiko S.

description: I love this place!  I was having a 1960's-food themed party and asked Earl if he could make any special desserts for it.  He said he'd do some research.  He called me the next day with about 6 different suggestions.  We went with the lime tartlets and the Pavlova.  They were a big hit!  Thanks, Earl.
author: J. D.

description:
Their pecan pie will seduce you, empty your wallet, and leave you wanting more.

AHHHHHHH YEAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH

As newbies to the area, we asked the pastry chef which creations were his favorite. He answered, "I only bake what I like to eat".

CORRECT ANSWER BABY.
author: Anh ..

description:
What a cool little place!

I was eating across the street and noticed the antiques sign and decided that I wanted to take a look.  Wasn't I surprised to find that there was a bakery in there as well!

They had an interesting assortment of antiques, with a definite food/small household items theme.  I ended up buying a reallycool liquor decantor that looks like an old school fire extinguisher.  The prices on everything looked very reasonable.

As for the bakery, they had a lot of enticing goods.  I was even impressed to see some desserts from other cultures on display as well.  I bought a bunch of cookies, as tey were only $.60 each.  The cookies were pretty good as well!
author: Joshua M.

description:
I like the selection of pies, cakes and cookies. I'm a pie man myself and their pies are excellent! The fruit is fresh and the crust is buttery and delicious. The owner and staff are nice and accommodating. 

The selection of antiques is what I love. There is a pair of matching prints in the window with four inch stainless frames. Tastefully drawn naked women with bubbles. My girlfriend says I can't get them for the living room, "but they're awesome" I replied. "I don't want naked blondes in my living room!" Touche dear, touche.
author: Corey V.

description:
In a country where European desserts are mediocre, we are lucky to have Lotta's Bakery is a fantastic place to get both European as well as American favorites.

In a word:  QUALITY!

The guy at the counter is always friendly and helpful. The shop is clean, nicely organized (appealing to the senses) and best of all...everything I have eaten there is just fantastic.

The variety for such a small place is awesome!  It is NOT easy creating so many different baked goods and pastries, and all of them being of above-average quality. The use of seasonal fruit, and fine ingredients, comes thru in a huge way!!

My personal favorites:  coconut cream pie, bread pudding, quince tart, carrot cake
author: Ted K.

description:
I discovered  Lotta's Bakery by accident 2 years ago when a visiting guest from NYC requested Key Lime Pie, her favorite dessert.  Earl made a wonderful and original Key Lime Pie . She said it was the best  Key Lime Pie she's ever tasted.
     A few months later,  he made the same Key Lime Pie for over 100 homeless men  fed by my church group as part of a shelter program.   Last month, he made a rich, delicious, moist , ( all butter)  chocolate  sheet cake when we did dinner for the same homeless shelter program,  and ,also a variety of tasty cupcakes for the volunteers.  Everyone was delighted.   Both  years, he donated some of the costs for the two homeless shelter desserts,  and,  was quite generous in giving us a lot of extra servings.  Many people have asked me who made these desserts?  I'm always happy to give out his card.
author: Patricia D.

description:
I don't eat baked goods much so when I do, they'd better be good! I'd heard good things about Lotta's, so when my b/f and I were in the neighborhood over the weekend we stopped in.  Thankfully, we weren't disappointed. We split three items, pumpkin bread, a cream cheese stuffed brownie and some kind of savory scone. We gulped them down before we finished running the rest of our errands. Oink, oink!

They also sell antiques at Lotta's, which makes this place not only yummy, but funky cool!
author: Joan S.

description:
I am a constant customer at Lotta's Bakery because i own Satin Crystals just next door!

I am not a big fan of sweets, but Earl and Richard are very nice and friendly neighbors.  They also have the cutest pink striped interior and exterior designs, and some cool collectibles.

As for the bakery, there are things I clearly like and those I don't.

What I love:  the weekend Quiches, peanut butter chocolate cookies, Apricot brown butter pie, Apple crumb cake, German chocolate cake.

What I did not like:  Apple pie, cherry pie, ginger molasses cake, sugar cookies, brownies.

Despite the fussiness of my taste buds, I appreciate the fact that everything is fresh and made on the location.  There are many more things for me to try, and I am sure I will!
author: Lisa X.

description:
I love Lotta's.  Everything I've tried there has been delicious.  Earl is very nice, and has met all of my special order requests (e.g., lots of icing on birthday cakes).  Prices are reasonable.  It's my (and my familly's) favorite bakery.
And take a few minutes to look at the antiques.  A couple of years ago I bought a art deco, polished aluminum sailboat that's still prominently displayed in a home window.  
Don't miss Lotta's!
author: Amy M.

description:
Whoever thought of selling Antiques with Baked goods? I don't know but whoever you are, you are awesome.

Lotta's Bakery is a quaint little bakery that has many faces to it. It's located off of Polk street so it's best if you park at one of the garages and walk down. Keep in mind that this place has a lot of bums lingering around its door steps and you WILL be asked if you are giving away your baked goods when walking out.

What do they specialize in? They sell antiques and household items along with an assortment of baked goods. An unlikely combination but the owner told me that he wanted to marry his two passions; "baking and old stuff"=) One of the BEST baked items they have are the Cheesecake brownie bars. Umm, can I say orgasmic? The Cheesecake brownie bars go for about $2.50 a pop but they are totally worth it. You can smell and taste the real cocoa powder that goes into it. One bite, and all you can say is mmmmmmmmm. The top layer is made of cheesecake and the bottom is brownie. There's a middle fudge layer which just makes both parts melt in your mouth. The after taste makes you want more. You HAVE to try them. Overall there prices are a little high for baked goods but I'd say its worth it. It's a mom and pop so I'd feed my money to them any day over the mass corporations.

Other than their Cheesecake/Brownie Bar star, I'd say that the scones are good. The almond and coconut cookies are not that great and there isn't a wide selection as in most other bakeries. They do sell loaves of bread which is nice since some of them are made with 100% whole wheat flour. It's really hard to make something healthy tasty and I think they do a good job with this. They also "theme" their baked goods depending on what's going on in the world. When it was William and Kate's Royal Wedding, they offered scones, biscuits, and tea. Very fitting for a king and queen =)

As for their antiques, nothing remarkable. They have some cute stuff but it's not the main attraction. You can find some cute stuff like an old style piggy bank. It was definitely fun to pass some time.

Should you try it? Yes, its definitely an experience. Correction. It's definitely a San Franciscan Experience since SF is known for its mix of different things!
author: Lakshmi R.

description:
This is where I go for my evening coffee and a peanut butter cup. The coffee cake is pretty good too.

The owners are super friendly and there are small items / antiques you can see at the back too.

Awesome place, friendly owners, wonderful treats... what else can you ask for?
author: Sumit C.

description: So I'm walking around in the area trying to buy cinnamon-sugar.  I walk into the bakery and the gentleman offered my a cupful on the house!  I ended up buying a few baked goods afterwards - those were great too.  Would highly recommend!
author: Josh F.

description:
If you're not feeling like baked goods, stop in just for the antiques in the back. Practically everything is under $50, and most items are under $40, so visit if you like doo-dads like beautiful hand-painted Japanese hatpin holders and nautical clocks.

I stopped in Lotta's for the first time today, coming directly from Town School Clothes Closet. It's hilarious that even when TSCC has one of their "whole store is 50%" sales, their fake antique vases and five year-old Nordstrom shoes are ridiculously overpriced.
author: Jena E.

description:
I would rate with just 1 star but since I've only tasted one cupcake from Lotta's, I'll go with 2 stars (in case other stuff Lotta's is better).

Red Velvet cupcakes are my favorite.  My co-worker says that she's going to walk to Lotta's after lunch and buy herself a dessert because she loves their cakes.  So, I ask her to bring me back to red velvet cupcake.  Yuck.  The cake was so dense (should be fluffy and moist?) and stale.  The frosting was heavy and definitely days old stale.  So many places make such good cupcakes, how can they keep this inedible thing on the menu?
author: Amy Y.

description:
How great, an antique store and a bakery all in one!!

The owner is even starting baking classes at the beginning of the year.

I just had a lemon meringue tart and it was delicious!
There were too many great desserts to choose from so I just had to get the apple strudel too.  

Next time, I'll come back for cupcakes. Or will it be coffee cake?  Maybe both!
author: Lauren C.

description:
This place is adorable and the baked good are amazing!
