Try the cream cheese brownie...1 layer of chocolate, followed by a layer of brownie, then the cream cheese, and another brownie layer. YUM!
author: Misha F.

description:
Lemon Meringue Tarts are delicious; I was only planning on eating half of it, but I couldn't stop, it was THAT good...I easily finished the whole thing.

The lemon was not too tart, the meringue on top was delicious and tasted like marshmallow fluff, overall delicious dessert! (also try freezing them, they taste good cold)
author: Elaine S.

description: Okay I can't comment on their food but their antiques were great.  The shop owner was working the front and just as friendly as they get.  Never bothered me as I looked around and when I made contact with him was willing to explain everything and anything in the store.  A real joy.  Just a great place to pass some time looking at "fun" antiques.
author: Frank E.

description:
*Get the almond macaroon!!  It's incredible!*

I stopped in on a whim to try their treats.  There were so many completely different options (cakes, cookies, cupcakes, bread pudding, other uncategorizable things...) I had no idea what to go for.  

So I picked up an almond macaroon just because it was one of the cheapest things in there (.80).  This is the best move I've ever made.  I'm not one to say food is orgasmic, but I stopped dead in my tracks and developed an instant case of Tourette's at my first bite, which for me is pretty close.  This cookie reminds me strongly of the famous Siena ricciarellis - I will definitely be back for more!
author: Alison M.

description: Delicious!  I love going to Lotta's to get desserts for parties - cakes, pies, cookies, you name it.  Everyone always raves about the food and asks where I got it.  So of course it was an easy decision to have Earl bake our wedding cakes.  He made a series of small cakes fashioned after a Thiebaud painting.  Each one was a different flavor and our guests loved them all.   The price for the cakes and delivery was very reasonable compared to other places I looked into.  Earl also let me borrow some adorable cake plates, helping me save money.  Wish I had some cake right now!
author: Suzy K.

description:
It's plenty pink, super satiny and about to open any day now. Promising old-fashioned goodness  baked into cookies, cakes and savory samplings. We shall see...real review to follow as soon as the doors open and I do the snacky snack.

.............................................................................................................................

Review: Question - Where can you pay $3 for a dried-out leaden mess of a cupcake so bad you will throw it out after two bites? Answer - Lotta's Bakery. Sad, so sad. It's an earnest little place, with a nice guy working the counter but DAMN that was seriously the WORST cupcake I have ever had. It was so dense and dry I thought it was a frosted rock. Lotta's, I'm sorry, but we are through. It was short, but never sweet.
author: wendella a.

description:
To start, a little background...

I was talking with my mom on the phone a few days back when she went off on this tangent about how her and my dad ate all these delicious pies, blah blah blah... well, when you're a susceptible sweet tooth, we all know how that story turns out....

So there I was, craving pie... not just any, but specifically Strawberry Rhubarb.  After Yelping the city for delicious pies, I stumbled across Lotta's Bakery and it's pretty decent reviews (not to mention it's about 4 blocks away).  I walked down to the store, and there it was, taunting me with glimmering sweet baked goods.

I walked into the shop and was greeted warmly, asked about the assortment of pies (mini lemon meringue pies, apple pies, etc).  Finally, we came to my craving, Strawberry Rhubarb.  The sweet lady went in the back to check and came back with one last Strawberry Rhubarb pie and was followed by Earl, the owner/baker.  I interrogated Earl about his pies and their deliciousness, then chose to purchase the whole pie for $18 (vs $3.50/slice).

I walked home promptly, cut out a slice, sat down, and placed a full fork into my mouth.  An orgasm of  deliciousness exploded in my mouth.  My tongue danced and my taste buds tangoed.  I called Earl and thanked him for an amazing pie.

So yes, I highly recommend Lotta's Bakery.  Go there, buy a pie, tell Earl "thank you", and enjoy a slice or two from Heaven.
author: Jason L.

description:
I randomly walked by Lotta's Bakery the other day and what a darling establishment.  I love the idea of a bakery and antique shop in one.  In NYC there is an antique and cheese shop together.  I use to purchase my pre-party appetizers along with the best bookshelf ever from Maya's in NYC.  

Now I am in SF and there is a similar shop.  From Lotta's I have purchased a beautiful pitcher that I'm using as my wine decanter and I have a fabulous lamp which I just picked up that was on hold.  The lamp is AMAZING.  The shade is made out of bone and heavy, but gorgeous.  What an amazing find and so affordable I couldn't believe it!

I have yet to try the sweets, but looking forward to doing so when I pick my lamp up.  

**An update - I tried the chocolate chip cookies when I picked up my outstanding lamp and the cookies are delicious.  I strongly recommend having at least one sweet treat and searching the antiques b/c you will find something you love - how could you not?**

The owners of the store are just as sweet as the treats!
author: Anjali K.

description:
Very good foccacia, fruit gallette, and italian breads.  Good addition to the neighborhood.

Never had the cookies or brownies -- but there's more to a bakery than just the sweets.
author: M.S. C.

description:
I soooo wanted to like this place.  I love baked goodies and it would have been nice to have a place near by instead of having to head over to That Takes the Cake every time (which I love!)  But this place has the audacity to charge $3 for a nasty, sand dried cupcake.  I can't cook but could have made an 1000% better tasting one with Betty Crocker.

The other positive reviews here must be from friends of the owner because there was nothing tasty about the baked goods here.
author: Lev E.

description:
What a great idea to have an antique shop and bakery in the same place! Although I'm not really into antiques, it was still nice to look through them before sitting down to some coffee and baked goods. 
Sitting there on a Sunday morning, eating some bread pudding, drinking coffee, and listening to KFOG piped in made me feel like I was at my grammy's.

They had a great array of baked goods but I wished they had a little more variety in coffee. Try the bread pudding and strawberry coffee cake!
author: Lale G.

description: chicken pot pie! the bomb, place is dope
author: Amy R.

description: Cheese and onion scones YUM! Love Love this place and the guys are so nice. Plus they have old school cameras to buy. This place is the whole package.
author: Mex B.

description: Tried the challah.  It was great, service was great.  Adorable shop.  Go here.
author: Sharon G.

description:
Honestly, I wasn't expecting much.  The cake in the window isn't all that impressive looking.*  Actually, I didn't go in for the longest time for that reason.  So- note to whomever does the window display- step up your game a bit maybe.  Despite the less than inspiring window, I spontaneously decided to stop in and buy a dozen cookies on the way to a friend's house one day.  They are exceptional cookies, and I've been back for more.  The other baked goods look amazing, and the people who work there are super nice.  Way better than that cookie on a stick place that was here before. 

* To be fair, I watch a lot of Food Network, and so maybe am expecting too much Duff-ness out of my neighborhood bakery.
author: Amanda B.

description:
My second favourite after Bob's doughnuts :))

You can satisfy your hunger and sugar cravings buying things from different categories there.

2 thumbs up for quality and variety! 
pastries kick ass!
author: Cat of a Donut J.

description:
I chanced upon this super cute and sweet place and it drawn me in.  They make everything from scratch in the back.  From breads to muffins, cakes, cookies, pies and various other pastries.  My friends and I sampled a bunch of different things and everything was done right.  Not too sweet, moist and oh so good.

Aside from the goodies that you can buy ... the store itself is just so cute that it should probably have been made of sugar.

Love it!
author: Winnie C.

description:
Wonderful neighborhood bakery that I found unexpectedly one day.  The owner is friendly and a true artist - his work is as beautiful as it is tasty.

At Christmastime, try the Bouche Noel (yule log cake).  I can't even imagine how much work must go into this amazing creation but it is well worth it.  Chocolate frosted cake shaped to look like a log with little frosted mushrooms and amazing and delicious details.  I actually took a picture of it.  It was that fabulous.  It makes a great treat to take to a Christmastime dinner or party.
author: Camilla R.

description:
We had Earl do our wedding cake earlier this month.  As we had a small wedding, it was hard finding someone who would do a cake for 15 people.  But, Earl was very accommodating, and we ended up getting a small two-tiered cake (one tier chocolate and one red velvet), covered in fondant.

The cake was beautiful -- I had sent Earl a photo of what I wanted (basic white fondant with a fondant ribbon and bow at the base of each tier) and he nailed it.  And, it was amazingly moist and delicious -- everyone commented on how tasty it was.  So tasty in fact, that we just got back from our honeymoon yesterday, and had a slice and it was STILL good.  Even the fondant tasted good, which I had no idea it could taste like anything other than crispy cardboard.

Earl delivered the cake on time, helped with set up and even let us borrow a cake stand.  We're so happy we went with Lotta's!
author: K. H.

description:
I completely agree with everyone who says that this place is fantastic and that Earl is the nicest guy and has a real midas touch. I especially like his chocolate dipped macaroons. Something else that is great is that he doesn't use too much sugar so things really have flavor, rather than just too much sweetness. The next time I go I want to try his carrot cake.

BTW - it's true, his black strap molasses cake is yum!!!
author: sarah k.

description: This place is lovely, the folks who work here are great and the food is delish! I went in for a birthday cake for my woman, and needed just an itty bitty cake as it was just the two of us, I ended up getting a mini chocolate cake.  We ended up calling it the chocolate cake bomb, and it was. Utterly utterly bomb. Such a good cake. We couldn't even finish it, and lord knows, we tried.
author: RJ M.

description:
I liked the cheescake too! It was a great texture, not too sweet. Its a nice alternative to doing the hill to whole foods for a sugary cake.  I've ordered a few of these and the response is great. 

They have different fresh baked breads on different days. 

The owner was nice enough to come out and show me the different sized pans because I needed a visual to order my cakes.  The staff is friendly and helpful.
author: Cheryl D.

description: What a great place to stumble upon in the 'hood.  Had a slice of the black strap molasses ginger cake - excellent!  A couple of biscotti - nicely fruity and not too sweet.  Gorgeous antique tea cups and saucers which I may treat myself to one of these days...
author: Ash A.

description:
It's funny how much attention a cupcake can get.

I bought a vanilla cupcake at Lotta's and continued on my merry way up Polk. At my next stop, the gentleman behind the counter said I had very good taste (he apparently LOVES their pastries). Oh the pride, the joy, when sweet-tooth instincts are validated! 

My dry cleaner thought it very prettily decorated and demanded an address, because a pretty cupcake is apparently very hard to find!

"How was the cupcake?" you might ask. Well, the butter cream was quite possibly the best sugary concoction I've ever had the pleasure of tasting. However, while I'm no connoisseur, the cake part did seem much too solid for something that you might think would be light and airy. 

Did this minor setback keep me away? Why no. 

Because on my next visit, I picked up some hot-out-of-the-oven cherry and apricot pie which truly was a thrill to eat. The bear claw was super good, too. They do seem to have good variety for a bakery that's been open for so short a time.

Moral of the story: well worth a visit if you enjoy pastries and desserts with substance. If you're easily tempted by just any pretty cupcake, you might be a little disappointed. But try, try again, because Lotta's is definitely worth it!
author: Julia C.

description:
Lotta's is great: we used them to make our wedding cakes.  So... a few words on our wedding - very non-traditional, non-ordinary with a very small, close-knit group of family and friends attending.  The wedding cakes were: Black Forest cake, Charlotte Malakoff cake, and a lemon cheesecake.  Yes, three cakes, but again, very non-traditional.  We placed our order with the owner/baker ( I never got his name).  He didn't seem fazed by the fact that we wanted very specific cakes - he even knew what a Malakoff was (many of the other bakers didn't know what it was).  Since it was over 1 month before the wedding date, we planned on picking up the cakes the morning of the ceremony.  I called the day before to confirm and make sure our order wasn't forgotten, and the nice girl who works the phones and the front counter was very casually said, "the order was being prepared and should be ready tomorrow morning."  So, I was pleasantly surprised they were on top of things.  The next morning wasn't a problem picking up the cakes, and when she showed us the cakes, I almost had to eat the Malakoff there... ummm, let me describe what a Malakoff is for those of you who have never had it.... the Malakoff is basically a liqueur-soaked ladyfinger cake, with rum-flavored creme.  And yes, it really was good; it was cut and devoured later that night... and then the next night we ate the crumbs.  The best cake crumbs I ever had.

Thanks to the baker-who-I-didn't-get-his-name - your cakes really made our wedding reception special.  Thanks!
author: B Y.

description:
Stopped in last week for some finger foods, and was impressed.  Goood food, nice folks.

Ordered a birthday cake from them.  Asked for something very chocolaty, and they recommended a silk cake.  Ordered one and presented it last night at a friend's party.  Definitely chocolaty!  Had us jittering from the richness.  Awesome.
author: Peter D.

description: Earl, the baker, is great.  He made a birthday cake for my son who just started school in SF.  After talking with him about the possibilities, I decided on the Blum's Coffee Candy Crunch, and he specially replaced the whipped cream frosting with a vegan frosting since my son is allergic to milk and cream.  They delivered at the time I requested (nominal charge) on a Sunday (his birthday).  My son shared it with his roommates and said the cake was really good.
author: R.A. S.

description:
This is Miss Piggy checking in again, 

   Lotta's was introduced to me by my lovely friend SB who lives in Nob Hill. Since she moved there, I think I've frequented this place everytime I hit the gym and decided that I'm going to come by her place. 

  This place is so cute and it's just nothing fancy, but really good! I think what really gets me is the man who runs this place has got those logos of a man who's a cross-dressing in heels. What a symbpl of San Francisco! Not to say, the pastries were delicious.. get some of their cookies and that little cheesecake, perfect for a small group of 4-5 and it's only 10-12 bucks I think. 

   You're going to really like Lotta's because it's really cute, and if you live in that neighborhood, you should definitely try it! 

 For a time, I worked out on Vanness and Polk and would walk up to Sacramento and Polk to gain back all those calories I burnt off.  Now I say, you go try it.
author: Miss Pigg y.

description: Fantastic bakery.   Love the carrot cake.
author: Jeanne B.

description:
After hearing a coworker rave about Lotta's cookies, I decided to get my birthday cake from there. So my 5 stars is based on only one visit.  

I went in assuming I could pre-order a cake but that wasn't even necessary because they had exactly what I wanted (made that morning apparently) sitting in the case.  It was a chocolate cake with chocolate butter cream frosting.  It looked small (maybe about a 9" double decker round cake) but she assured me it was rich enough to last a while.  The sales person was very timid but very courteous.  The baker (Lotta?) came out from the back to tell us about storing the cake. Awesome! Very useful info about not refrigerating the cake if we were going to eat it that night.  They put my name on it in 5 minutes and I was in and out in 15 min.

So the cake was great and delicious but the frosting was hands down the best frosting I've ever had: not too sweet, rich, CREAMY, and velvety.  I couldn't stop eating it.  Actually, I think I ate all of it.  

If you want to indulge (calories not money) and love baked goods, try Lotta's.

P.S. I think the cake was about $40 but it was a treat from my mom so I'm not too sure
author: Jennie A.

description:
UPDATE (9/11/07):  I'm adding one star b/c I requested a Coffee Crunch cake for my bf's party.  It currently wasn't on the list of available cakes.  (I knew to order b/c I had seen it months before in their display)  The lovely owner made it for me anyways (w/ 24 hours notice).  It was INSANELY good!  Rave reviews all around!  


Some of the BEST cheesecake I've ever had!  I've now purchased 2 cheesecakes from this bakery for 2 different b-day dinners.  And they were a hit both times.  

Their service is very friendly!  And with enough advance notice, they will make you whatever you'd like.  

Minus one star for their cupcakes.  Very disappointing.
author: Amanda U.

description:
i'm not sure what to make of this place. i walked in and saw the cases that looked like they might house baked goods but those sights fought with sights of countless old things with tags. some might consider it charming to have a hybrid antique(?) store/bakery. i find it odd. 

and just as i've mentioned on an different bakery review, this baker also stares and you and asks what you want the second you approach the counter. "HOW SHOULD I KNOW?? i just friggin got here!!!" runs through my head. 

anyway, i got a cheesecake brownie which was more cheesecake than it was brownie. and the two brownie layers were really thin and almost crispy rather than chewy or fudgy. it was tasty nonetheless.

***be careful for meter maids. all my life i thought that you could park in  yellow zones for atleast 15 minutes as long as you put money in the meter.  i guess i stand corrected.  i literally was in a yellow zone for 3 minutes and got a $75 ticket. that is one damn expensive brownie.
author: Regina C.

description: I love finding special vintage pieces...at the flea market, on line, and garage sales but ever since I found Lotta's it is my go to place. Picture a 1950's console on a marble platform with a fake fireplace on the bottom  that lights up when you plug it in, a working radio, and a bar on top with red curtains...Don Draper would be in heaven-and it was only $400! After I bought it the owner said 10 people wanted to buy it and I believe it...someone tried to buy it when i went in to pick it up. There is a great bakery in front and tons of vintage finds in back...I bought a gorgeous art deco mirror-another steal-and a 1920's fashion illustration. Prices are great, the people are nice, and it's so fun to poke around the treasures.
author: ruth c.

description: I dare you to try walking past this place without going in to try at least 1 baked good!  Pumpkin bread was fresh out of the oven this morning, and completely delicious.  The gentleman who rang up my order was delightful.  Great spot!
author: Breah P.

description: Lotta's is a real neighborhood bakery. I sat there and enjoyed a piece of extremely rich (gooey and expen$ive) carrot cake with an OK cup of pre-brewed coffee and listened as neighborhood residents came in to peruse and order pastries.
author: stephanie l.

description: Best apricot pie I have ever had.  Looks like an antique shop from the outside...don't let that fool you, these folks know what they are doing.
author: Randy C.

description: OK god the bread pudding is like heaven. Try something you like and you will be happy. I was and will be next time!!!!!
author: Brandi R.

description: Super cute and friendly but I need good product as well. Cookies are great but the cinnamon rolls are dry and bread pudding is basically just bread.
author: David C.

description: Their cookies taste like shortening mixed with water and flour.  I have never had worse cookies.
author: Emma Q.

description: I followed the advice and didn't get any cupcakes. I got some bread pudding, a few cookies, and a piece of apple strudel. The place is nice but the bakery area seems like a pretty small portion of it, and the employee who helped me was quite friendly. I brought all of this to a brunch, along with some delicious donuts from Bob's donuts. The donuts were demolished pretty quickly, and people eventually moved on to the items from Lotta's. The apple strudel was honestly not good, and I would not recommend it - there was a nice amount of walnuts, but they were in huge pieces and not very tasty. The strudel itself may have just been undercooked, but it tasted floury and fairly leaden. The bread pudding wasn't very interesting either - kind of dry, and the bread was overly sweet (it paled in comparison to the bread pudding from bob's!). The cookies were better - the peanut butter was actually pretty good, and the mexican wedding cookie was fine - but neither was outstanding. The chocolate chip was mediocre - I think I can make better and I'm not the world's best baker. So, as much as I love bakeries, I won't be back to this one.
author: Lisa K.

description: Great regular cakes, pies, molasses cake, bread pudding (the best!), etc -no fine dining bakery - instead, you'll find delicious, hearty baked goods - we like to order pies and cakes for the holidays too
author: R F.

description: Cute place but I can't say the baked goods are that great.  The owner isn't friendly at all.  I would much rather buy my baked goods at Schubert's, Yasukochi's Sweet Stop or La Boulange.
author: Flog G.

description: The owner is the most adorably sweet man. The apple pie is amazing as was the lemon meringue tart. The peanut butter cookies are wonderful and the chocolate torte is fudgy and rich- perfect for a chocolate obsessed lass like myself. I cannot wait to place an order for the Coffee Crunch Cake-  I may need to throw myself a dinner party just so I have an excuse to order it.
author: Noelle Q.

description: OH GOD, You must try the Blum's Coffee Crunch Cake, As good as I remember the Original maybe better.
author: Ed A.

description: They get five stars because they make great cakes and cupcakes.  My wife would rave about her favorite birthday cake growing up, so I described it to Lotta's and they made me one.  It was a hit.  I went back for the same cake this December.  Also, I love their cupcakes, but most importantly, my children love them.  I'll be back for my usual cake this December, and look forward to being in the area to pick up a sweet when I'm in the area.  Great place!
author: Axs S.

description: I've got a whole lotta love for Lotta's.  I've only tried the honey cake and the blueberry yogurt cake, both of which were totally scrumptious and yet unassuming (no need to do all this fanfare with icing or layers).  These cakes are perfect with tea and the store has a cozy mellow vibe.  I can't wait to go back for more!
author: Janut B.

description: It's fun to go into a real bakery instead of getting baked goods at the coffee shop.  Lotta's is cute and the service is amicable.  I ordered up a whole pie for company and walked out with a mini cake to go with it.  The pie was a real gem - the filling was nice and sweet, but it totally let the fruit shine - chunky peaches.  Thanks, Lotta's.
author: T-Bone L.

description: I would go back to San Francisco just to get a cookie from this place. I was touring the neighborhood since I was staying at the Opal on Van Ness.  I had a sweet tooth, so I figured I'd get a little something to take back to the room.  I got one peanut butter and one oatmeal raisin cookie.  When I got back to the room and dug into the cookies, I wished that I had gotten more.  I wanted to run back to the bakery and  see "the cookie man."  Alas, that was to be my only taste of Lotta's Bakery.  I found them on a Sunday.  They're closed on Mondays and my plane left early Tuesday morning.  I still dream about those cookies!
author: Saundra L.

description:
I designed some cookies with Earl the owner for my work and the sugar cookies came out very cute as well as very yummy.  Earl has been very accommodating when it comes to what I need in terms of order size and pick up times.  

I always end up picking up some pie and the Strawberry Rhubarb is probably my favorite.  

I've had two types of cake from here- Red Velvet Cake and the other was a Chocolate Espresso Mousse cake (?) and I've been very happy both times.  They were both ordered for special occasion and they definitely impressed the crowds.  

The only thing I wish they had were single pieces of Princess cake to go.
author: cynthia l.

description: I just discovered this place today. It's clean, inviting, the employee I dealt with was very friendly, and they make a moist, tongue-tingling black strap molasses gingerbread that puts that wimpy light brown gingerbread to shame.
author: Katrina J.

description: Ordered a cake for my fiance's 6-year old daughter this past weekend.  She wanted it to look like a princess.  Earl did a fabulous job on 2 days notice and the cake turned out even more beautiful that I expected.  It was a white cake with fresh strawberries and buttercream and was super yummy!   All the little girls at the birthday party were entranced with the cake and all the moms were asking us where we picked up the cake!  Thank you Earl!
author: Bonny Y.

description: You simply can't go wrong at Lotta's Bakery. The chef and owner, Earl, has the Midas touch when it comes to baking, and everything I have tasted from Lotta's has been pure gold. And it's so nice to have a really great bakery in the neighborhood. From amazing breads to special occasion cakes to that afternoon pick-me-up cookie, you gotta go to Lotta's!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Lotta has the best sweet things in town. My husband and I always stop by after our Saturday workout to get our rewards... I guess you could say the only reason we get up early for a 2 hours workout is so we can then go to Lotta's Bakery.

We love their bread pudding (made partially with cinamon rolls), coffe cakes with seasonal fruits, apple pie (and all sort of seasonal pies), quiches, and the tres leche cake.... Oh, the tres leches cake.... It's to die for. Their cakes are very good too.

You certainly have to give Lotta a try.
author: sf g.

description: I use his service for my wedding cake (sept 5, 2009), its good impression first of all and i ask my detail for my wedding cake and end up he can do it and i dont care bout the price. And so dissapointed when i see my wedding cake its not exatcly the same what he explain to me(specailly bout the detail) and one of my detail is put a california map and virginia map, which he promises with orange color but it didn't happen. so dissapointed. but i admit the taste of the cake is good, i got compliment from my guest.
author: christine s.

description: Everything I have tried here has been excellent. There is an intensity of flavor in whatever they do that is difficult to match ... but certainly easy to enjoy. This is a special little place - and the blackstrap molasses gingerbread is worthy of a crosstown trip all on its own.
author: Steve R.

description: I was looking specifically for a German chocolate cake for my boss's birthday, and it took me a while to find a place that looked like it had a good one and this was it.  And it turned out that the cake was amazing.  Huge hit with everyone at work.
author: John P.

description: No, thanks I don't like macaroons, no really I'm just not a macaroon eater I guess, no I don't want a bite, frankly I  hate macaroons. Okay, just a bite, I'm not eating the whole wretched thing..wow, that's good, that's really good...give me the rest, no, I don't care what I said this isn't really a macaroon, this something good, really,really good...you got another one in that box. These should be called something different, calling them macaroons is just going to put people off, these things are awesome (and I don''t use that word, I'm just trying to find some acceptable substitute for fuckin' fabulous, oh I don't use that word either) You go GEarl !!!
author: James T.

description: I love this place!!! Besides doing a wonderful job on my wedding cake 2 years ago, this is my go to bakery for all my events. They just did my birthday cake and it tasted like heaven! Everyone loved it. Also all there baked goods are amazing. Everything I have bought for parties, thanksgiving and chanukah's have been a big hit. The owner is super nice and can make whatever you ask of him. This place is a gem!
author: jessica n.

description: San Francisco finally has a really good bakery. Most bakeries are  good to very good. Lotta's bakery is just plain fantastic and we are so happy they are here. After retiring in 2000 I worked in the bakery industry as a cake decorator for 5 years and pastry chef for 2  and know what a good baker is all about. Earl, the owner, is a fantastic pastry chef and baker that has that "it" factor.   My most recent purchase was a pear pie and a big slice of bread pudding. OH MY GOD!!!  Thanks Earl!  see ya next time.
author: paul c.

description:
Meandering around Polk Street this past weekend - wondering where we might get something to please our sweet tooth.  What a shock that a BAKERY sign would catch our attention.  We took a peek in through the window, were reading a posted newspaper review and noticing that they guy in the photo looked suspiciously like the man sitting on the other side of the window...

A minute later we were beckoned in by his friend.  Who are we to refuse?  We say to each other that we'll just take a peek.  

The goods looked amazing!  All kinds of cookies and pastries - and even perfect looking hamantashen - the triangular shaped pastry typically made around Purim.  There are cupcakes and macaroons and brownies and bars - all just calling out to us.  

And you know something else...the prices are unbelievable!  When was the last time you saw ANYTHING in a bakery under $2? We decided to exert some restraint and limited ourselves to one very  delicious (and amply sized) 7 layer bar for $1.80!   It seemed like all the cookies were priced under 2 bucks.  Now I'm wishing we would've gotten more.  So much better than the strawberry galette we got from Mission Pie the night before (although I will say the crust of that galette was yummy).

Very friendly staff - always a plus. We will definitely be back to try a lotta Lotta's goodies!  (And we'll likely give Mission Pie a 2nd chance as well).
author: L F.

description: Just a reminder about Lotta's Bakery.  They are accepting orders for Christmas.  They have gingerbread houses and bouche de noel (christmas log).  Lotta also makes, by special order, Blum's famous coffee crunch cake.  Try it
author: Marie M.

description: This bakery is chock full of yummy things! It is impossible to leave without a big bag!  Do NOT miss the chocolate bottom macaroons and the almond macaroons! They are THE best I have had anywhere!  It's worth a drive across town!
author: k k.

description: I had a great experience - I wanted to order a "special" (not on the menu) cake.  I was able to order over the phone and my cake was perfect.  Really, it was beyond perfect.  It was the best cake I've had in a long, long time.  The marzipan "frosting" was amazing and the cake looked fantastic.  It is nice that we have these little non-chain places in San Francisco.  Better service, better taste.
author: cj f.

description: My husband and I hired Lotta's Bakery to do our wedding cake.  We were looking for a cake that was simple and a price to reflect that! We got that from Lotta's Bakery and Earl, who gave us the exact cake we wanted and a great price.  The tasting was great...we tried three flavors and went for the rich chocolate. Earl was very easy to contact, which is very important when choosing a vendor. Overall, we were very happy with our wedding cake and got compliments from our guests.  I have not yet visited Lotta's Bakery for any of their other pastries, which is why I cannot give it 5 stars. But from my experience with them, I would say that yes, I am a fan!
author: Vanessa D.

description: The macaroons here are sooo good. It's a little pricey, but it's worth it.
author: K M.

description: I've been here a couple times and I've got to say that the pastries are amazing. The double chocolate chip and peanut butter cookies was so good. The scones was just heavenly and their banana bread is moist. The one thing I didn't like was their apple pie but that's because they use a mixture of apples (or it seemed like) so the apples were more sour than sweet, but some people like that and I'm not going to count that against them. The staff was very friendly and I can definitely see myself coming here again.
author: Richard C.

description: This is a great addition to the neighborhood. A friend served Lotta's cheesecake at Christmas dinner, and a couple of weeks later I was still craving one for home. So I picked up a mini version last week and it was as light, lemony and delicious as I remembered. The owner is a lovely man who makes his customers feel welcome and appreciated. I think the cream cheese brownie will be my next selection, based on reviews. Yum!
author: Kelly M.

description: I love, love, love this bakery.  I was attracted to it by the vintage look with the cheerful pink and yellow stripes walls.  I tried the lemon meringue tart and thought I had died and gone to heaven.  I have since tried the pumpkin pie, apple pie, cookies, banana bread, and linzer torte.  Everything I have eaten there is to die for in desert dining.  The owner is so warm and friendly as are the staff.  I go out of my neighborhood to go there now several times a week.  You can not go wrong by any of their goodies & you will leave there happier than when you came in.
author: Johanna C.

description: Walked by Lotta's after dinner with the bf and a couple of friends recently.   Twas a bummer they were closed or else I would've definitely paid a visit.  Went back the next day during business hours.  The bakery is small but very interesting.  As other fellow yelpers wrote it's a bakery and antique shop.  I'm not too much into antiques so didnt look around.  Besides, for me, antiques would lose to sweets anyday!  I wanted to try everything, but decided on a lemon meringue pie, a powdered cookie (I think they're called mexican cookies?), a chocolate peanut butter cup, and a chocolate macaroon.  The lemon meringue is by far the best I've had!  Seriously if you love lemon meringue you must try one at Lotta's.  You can tell after the first bite that only quality ingredients are used.  The macaroon was crispy on the outside and chewy in the inside.  My boyfriend who is not a huge fan of sweets also enjoyed the lemon meringue.  Everything we got were very good but the lemon meringue was exceptional!  Can't wait to go back and try other goodies.
author: Amy T.
